alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Douglas; Geary; Jackson; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 9:56AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Jefferson, northeastern Dickinson, Geary, southern Riley, central Morris, Shawnee, northwestern Douglas, Wabaunsee, northwestern Osage, southern Pottawatomie, southwestern Jackson and northwestern Lyon Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 955 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Hoyt to 5 miles northwest of White City. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Manhattan, Junction City, Wamego, Council Grove, Rossville, Alma, Eskridge, Tecumseh, St. Marys, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Meriden, Hoyt, St. George, Lecompton and Maple Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 289 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 160 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Dickinson; Douglas; Geary; Jackson; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
